Description: Fragment of solid-cast bird-claw in copper alloy; just one toe partially preserved; maybe part of fitting element of a bird figure such as a falcon, often associated with Horus (?); very corroded.
Curator's comments: Several better preserved fittings for falcon figures were discovered in Naukratis: BM 1885,1101.108; Boston, Museum of Fine Arts 86.301; Bristol, City Art Gallery & Museum H1082.2; Liverpool, World Museum 9,9,86,114. Another small fragment: Bristol, City Art Gallery & Museum H2205.10. Falcon bronzes are usually associated with Horus (Weiss 2012, 281-282), though several deities and the pharaoh himself are linked with this form (Davies, Smith 2005, 54). Davies, S., Smith, H.S. 2005, The sacred animal necropolis at North Saqqara: the falcon complex and catacomb (Egypt Exploration Society Memoirs 73), London. Weiss, K. 2012, Ägyptische Tier- und Götterbronzen aus Unterägypten: Untersuchungen zu Typus, Ikonographie und Funktion sowie der Bedeutung innerhalb der Kulturkontakte zu Griechenland, Ägypten und Altes Testament 81.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (MB.250) (phase 3)
